question: My grandson who is two, was found to have bi-lateral neurosensory hearing loss at two months of age.  He is receiving a whole range of help and will be starting school in January 2009.  He regularly requires new hearing aids as he is growing they do not last very long and being so young will only keep then in his ears when in playschool and will take them out when leaving.  I have had a thought, in that he drinks a lot in fact a great deal and I wonder if there may be a link to diabetis.  Any help you can give will be gratefully received.
title: Hearing
